# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code that fulfills your requirements:

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    words = split(text, ' ')
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(current_line * " $word") > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = "$word"
        else
            current_line *= " $word"
        end
    end
    push!(lines, current_line)  # add the last line
    return join(lines, "\n")   # join lines with newline character
end
```

You can use this function as follows:

```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Integer nec odio. " *
       "Praesent libero. Sed cursus ante id lacinia. Nullam nulla eros, imperdiet non, " *
       "commodi a, euismod sed, mi. Proin fermentum massa ac quam. Sed diam turpis, " *
       "molestie vitae, placerat nec, euismod in, nulla. Vestibulum ante ipsum primis " *
       "in faucibus orci luctus et ultrices posuere cubilia Curae; Sed aliquam, " *
       "consequat a, enim at tempore justo."

print(wrap_string(text))
```

This will print:

```julia
Praesent libero. Sed cursus ante id lacinia. Nullam nulla eros, imperdiet non, 
commodi a, euismod sed, mi. Proin fermentum massa ac quam. Sed diam turpis, 
molestie vitae, placerat nec, euismod in, nulla. Vestibulum ante ipsum primis 
in faucibus orci luctus et ultrices posuere cubilia Curae; Sed aliquam, 
consequat a, enim at tempore justo.
```
